name: Large Wood Frequency and Diversity
functionStatement: Supports aquatic habitats through streambed material and bedform dynamics. Enhances habitat complexity and streambank stability.
descriptionMarkdown: Large wood abundance and the presence of key pieces support pools, bars, and habitat diversity; expectations vary by stream size and region.
howToMeasureMarkdown: Walk a representative reach and rate wood abundance in broad bins; note key pieces/rootwads/jams; use aerial imagery for visible jams and compare to reference conditions.

levels.label: Strongly Disagree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Almost no large wood where expected.
Criteria: No key pieces or jams; far below reference unless naturally low wood.

levels.label: Disagree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Very little wood; mostly small/decayed pieces.
Criteria: Few or no key pieces; limited hydraulic influence.

levels.label: Agree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Moderate wood; some larger pieces but patchy.
Criteria: Slightly below reference; habitat added but less consistent.

levels.label: Strongly Agree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Abundant large wood with key pieces/rootwads or small jams.
Criteria: Meets upper-range reference for density and variety.
